A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

str2: To rend, divide asunder, cleave. Apparently a primary verb; to split or sever.

str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
